questions.text: For some reason, a fish is caught on land! The fish has a temperature of 45°F. The air outside has a temperature of 65°F. What is going to happen?

answerChoices.text: Heat will flow from the air to the fish until they have the same temperature.
Heat will flow from the fish to the air until they have the same temperature.
Heat will flow from the air to the fish, but they will end with the different temperatures.
Heat will flow from the fish to the air, but they will end with different temperatures.

questions.text: Which of these will most likely be the final temperature of the fish?

Two potions are mixed. The red potion has a temperature of 50°C, and the blue potion has a temperature of 10°C. They have very similar masses and specific heats. What will most likely be the final temperature of the mixture?

A few rocks with a temperature of 80°C are added to a cup of water with a temperature of 20°C. The rocks have a specific heat similar to that of most metals, and have about 10% the mass of the water. Which of the following will most likely be the final temperature of the mixture? You can figure this out using conceptual reasoning instead of a formula.
How does heat flow between two objects of different temperature in thermal contact.?

answerChoices.text: From the warmer object to the cooler object until they reach the same temperature.
From the cooler object to the warmer object until they reach the same temperature.
From the warmer object to the cooler object, but they will not reach the same temperature.
From the cooler object to the warmer object, but they will not reach the same temperature.
Heat does not flow between two objects of different temperature in thermal contact.
A point when two objects have the same temperature.
A point when two objects temperatures have been averaged.
A point when the specific heat times the mass is times temperature squared is equal to Q.
The average of the heat of fusion and the heat of vaporization.
When heat energy is equal to the kinetic energy plus the gravitational potential energy of an object.
